title: Robe of Folly
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                      |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A dull grey robe. It is enchanted to provide mages with immeasurable power, and more than a little overconfidence... |

[![Robe of folly.png](/images/2/23/Robe_of_folly.png)](/File:Robe_of_folly.png) ***the +4 robe of Folly***

+4 [robe](/Robe "Robe")

Brilliance ([Boosts spellpower](/Archmagi "Archmagi") and [halves mana costs](/Potion_of_brilliance "Potion of brilliance"))  
-∞ [Will](/Will "Will")  
+8 [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence")

## Desirability

With a massive boost to every aspect of spellcasting, the **robe of Folly**[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) is a tempting piece of armour for any spellcaster. However, its drawback of setting your [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") to 0 should not be taken lightly -- an encounter with an opponent capable of [banishing](/Banish "Banish") or [paralysing](/Paralyse "Paralyse") you can very easily get you killed. Even [confusion](/Confusion "Confusion") can be devastating.

Many will find this robe not worth the risk when seeking to successfully retrieve the [Orb](/Orb_of_Zot "Orb of Zot") and escape. Still, it allows casters to inflict fantastic amounts of carnage by spamming powerful, wide-range spells like [Ozocubu's Refrigeration](/Ozocubu%27s_Refrigeration "Ozocubu's Refrigeration") or [Starburst](/Starburst "Starburst"); if you *do* choose to make use of it, just don't be surprised when this robe becomes your folly.

Note that some [Lair](/Lair "Lair") rune branches (the [Spider's Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest"), [Snake Pit](/Snake_Pit "Snake Pit"), and [Shoals](/Shoals "Shoals")) do not have *immediately* threatening enchantments. [Mesmerisation](/Mesmerisation "Mesmerisation"), for example, is still hard to deal with, but not immediately life-threatening. But even in these branches, you can find certain [uniques](/Unique "Unique") like [Louise](/Louise "Louise") and [Rupert](/Rupert "Rupert") with deadly hexes, and any humanoid monster can pick up a [wand of paralysis](/Wand_of_paralysis "Wand of paralysis") (if this wand [has generated](/Alternate_items "Alternate items")).

Unlike regular robes of [Archmagi](/Archmagi "Archmagi"), [potions of brilliance](/Potions_of_brilliance "Potions of brilliance") do nothing while you're wearing this robe.

## History

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), the robe of Folly had [Archmagi](/Archmagi "Archmagi") instead of Brilliance, reduced will by -80, had +5 intelligence, and had a 50% chance to [curse](/Curse "Curse") on equip.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), the robe of Folly's [magic resistance](/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") penalty was -100 instead of -80.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), the robe of Folly was a strictly bad artifact. It was a -1 robe that completely prevented spellcasting instead of having an MR malus.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [art-data.txt:955](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/art-data.txt#L955) (0.30.1)

Desirability

With a massive boost to every aspect of spellcasting, the robe of Folly[1] is a tempting piece of armour for any spellcaster. However, its drawback of setting your willpower to 0 should not be taken lightly -- an encounter with an opponent capable of banishing or paralysing you can very easily get you killed. Many will find this robe not worth the risk when seeking to successfully retrieve the Orb and escape.
